interface.name: 0compile
interface.summary: create a binary release from source code
interface.description:
0compile creates a binary from source code, either for your own use or ready for publishing on the web through Zero Install. It works by setting up a build environment and then executing the (source) interface. The default source implementation is executed in the following environment:
- Read access to all build dependencies (from the source interface)
- Write access to $TMPDIR (empty, deleted after the build)
- Write access to $BUILDDIR, which is also the current directory (this persists over builds by default, to speed up rebuilds)
- Write access to $DESTDIR (the final binary package and interface)
- No write access anywhere else.
- Read access to $SRCDIR
If plash is not installed, the read-only restrictions are not enforced, but you should follow them anyway.
As a special case, the source interface may specify compile-type='CMM', in which case the 'main' attribute gives the location of an autoconf configure script and the familiar './configure && make && make install' sequence will be run with appropriate options passed to configure to use the correct directories.
